      • find

        public static <T> int find(T[] arr,
           T obj)
        Searches for an element in an array, returning its index if present. The objects in the array are first compared by reference with the given object, and then by means of the equals() method.
        Parameters:
        arr - the array to search in
        obj - the object to search for in the given array
        Returns:
        the index of the given object in the array if it is present, or -1 otherwise

      • contains

        public static <T> boolean contains(T[] arr,
                   T obj)
        Tells whether an element is present in an array. The objects in the array are first compared by reference with the given object, and then by means of the equals() method.
        Parameters:
        arr - the array to search in
        obj - the object to search for in the given array
        Returns:
        true iff the object is present in the given array
